text:
FOREIGN TELEGRAMS.

[THROUGH REUTER'S AGENCY.]

AMERICAN MINERS AND THE EIGHT HOURS QUESTION.

New York, April 9.—The position of affairs of the Inter-State convention at Pittsburg indicates that the coal operatives and miners in Pennsylvania and Ohio find it difficult to agree on the eight hours working day question, and that 75,000 men will quit work on May 1, unless their demand is granted or a compromise effected.

ITALIAN EMIGRANTS TO THE UNITED STATES.

New York, April 9.—Twenty-four Italian emigrants will be sent back to Europe on board the steamer Burgundia, because they are sufferers from contagious diseases or have no means of support.

BANDITTI IN CUBA.

Havana, April 9.—Three persons who were recently kidnapped in the district of Yaguajay, by bandits, have been released on payment of a ransom.
